intro: Pithecellobium longifolium, commonly known as the longleaf pithecellobium, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland areas. The plant is characterized by its long, slender leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It produces pods that contain edible seeds, which are often used in local cuisines. The plant also has a deep root system that helps stabilize soil and prevent erosion.
